class bhp_crypto.classes.Base(*args, **kwargs)¶
class bhp_crypto.classes.BaseCrypter(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: bhp_crypto.classes.base.Base

Base class for all classes providing RSA and AES encryption methods.

aes_decrypt(secret, is_encoded=True)¶

AES encrypt using the random iv stored with the secret where secret is a tuple (secret_text, sep, iv).

Will return plaintext or the original secret tuple

aes_encrypt(plaintext)¶

Return secret as a tuple (secret,iv) or fail.

Important to not allow any data to be saved if the keys are not available

create_aes_key(suffix='2012-07-19 16:16:43.065510', key=None)¶

Create a new key and store it safely in a file by using local-rsa-encryption.

Filename suffix is added to the filename to avoid overwriting an existing key

create_new_rsa_key_pairs(suffix='2012-07-19 16:16:43.065494')¶

Create a new rsa key-pair.

get_encrypted_salt()¶

This is the encrypted salt (which is what is stored in the file)

get_local_rsa_private_keyfile()¶

Return the local-rsa key filename.

is_encrypted(value, prefix='enc1:::')¶

The value string is considered encrypted if it starts with ‘self.hash_prefix’ or whichever prefix is passed.

mask_encrypted(value, mask='<encrypted>')¶

Help format values for display by masking them if encrypted at the time of display.

preload_all_keys()¶

Force all keys to be loaded and populate dictionary preloaded_keys .

class bhp_crypto.classes.Crypter(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: bhp_crypto.classes.base_crypter.BaseCrypter

Subclass to be used with models that expect to stored just the hash and for this class to handle the secret.

decrypt(secret, secret_is_hash=True, **kwargs)¶

Decrypt secret and if secret is a hash, use hash to lookup the real secret first.

Do not assume secret is an encrypted value, look for hash_prefix or secret prefix. By default we expect secret to be the stored field value – which is a hash. If we use this method for a secret that is not a hash, then the prefix is the secret_prefix and the lookup step is skipped.

encrypt(value, **kwargs)¶

Return the encrypted field value (hash+secret) where secret is secret or secret+secret_iv.

get_db_prep_value(hash_secret)¶

Update the secret lookup and return just the hash.

get_hash(value)¶

hash is stored for exact match search functionality as the cipher is never the same twice

update_secret_in_lookup(hash_secret)¶

update a model to have a reference of hash_value / cipher_value pairs
